column4: hey, quick question: after installing samba, what was the command to make smbmount useable by all users or something like that?
you can specify a mount point under /etc/fstab, then all users can mount it... if that's what you're referring to
Uh, nope, and I couldn't understand that either x_x I mean it was something with chown or set the userID or something like that oO
when I want users to be able to mount partitions, i drop a single line into the /etc/fstab, and they can mount/unmount it at will.
but this is samba, you know, network filesystems :/
you can do it with samba filesystems, once samba is installed :)
Oh cool, didn't know that, yay for flexibility :D
do you want it 'always' mounted, or a choice by the user?
fozzie:  yikes.  then, yes, i'm surpprised you're pulling 800fps out of glxgears lol
